titleInfo.title: NATIONAL SEA GRANT COLLEGE PROGRAM AMENDMENTS ACT OF 2015

name.namePart: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

extension.searchTitle: NATIONAL SEA GRANT COLLEGE PROGRAM AMENDMENTS ACT OF 2015; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 105

congVote.result: Three-fifths of the Senators duly chosen and sworn having voted in the affirmative, the motion is agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: By 68 yeas to 30 nays (Vote No. 116), Senate concurred in the House amendment to S. 2328, to reauthorize and amend the National Sea Grant College Program Act, after taking action on the following motions and amendments proposed thereto:<P/>McConnell motion to concur in the House amendment to the bill, with McConnell Amendment No. 4865, to change the enactment date. (By 44 yeas to 54 nays (Vote No. 114), Senate earlier failed to table the motion to concur.)<P/>During consideration of this measure today, Senate also took the following action:<P/>By 68 yeas to 32 nays (Vote No. 113), three-fifths of those Senators duly chosen and sworn, having voted in the affirmative, Senate agreed to the motion to close further debate on McConnell motion to concur in the House amendment to the bill.<P/>McConnell motion to refer the House message on the bill to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources, with instructions, McConnell Amendment No. 4867, to change the enactment date, fell when cloture was invoked on McConnell motion to concur in the House amendment to the bill.

By 68 yeas to 30 nays (Vote No. 116), Senate concurred in the House amendment to S. 2328, to reauthorize and amend the National Sea Grant College Program Act, after taking action on the following motions and amendments proposed thereto:<P/>McConnell motion to concur in the House amendment to the bill, with McConnell Amendment No. 4865, to change the enactment date. (By 44 yeas to 54 nays (Vote No. 114), Senate earlier failed to table the motion to concur.)<P/>During consideration of this measure today, Senate also took the following action:<P/>By 68 yeas to 32 nays (Vote No. 113), three-fifths of those Senators duly chosen and sworn, having voted in the affirmative, Senate agreed to the motion to close further debate on McConnell motion to concur in the House amendment to the bill.<P/>McConnell motion to refer the House message on the bill to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources, with instructions, McConnell Amendment No. 4867, to change the enactment date, fell when cloture was invoked on McConnell motion to concur in the House amendment to the bill.<P/>McConnell Amendment No. 4868 (to (the instructions) Amendment No. 4867), of a perfecting nature, fell when McConnell motion to refer the House message on the bill to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources, with instructions, McConnell Amendment No. 4867, fell.

By 68 yeas to 30 nays (Vote No. 116), Senate concurred in the House amendment to S. 2328, to reauthorize and amend the National Sea Grant College Program Act, after taking action on the following motions and amendments proposed thereto:<P/>McConnell motion to concur in the House amendment to the bill, with McConnell Amendment No. 4865, to change the enactment date. (By 44 yeas to 54 nays (Vote No. 114), Senate earlier failed to table the motion to concur.)<P/>During consideration of this measure today, Senate also took the following action:<P/>By 68 yeas to 32 nays (Vote No. 113), three-fifths of those Senators duly chosen and sworn, having voted in the affirmative, Senate agreed to the motion to close further debate on McConnell motion to concur in the House amendment to the bill.<P/>McConnell motion to refer the House message on the bill to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources, with instructions, McConnell Amendment No. 4867, to change the enactment date, fell when cloture was invoked on McConnell motion to concur in the House amendment to the bill.<P/>McConnell Amendment No. 4868 (to (the instructions) Amendment No. 4867), of a perfecting nature, fell when McConnell motion to refer the House message on the bill to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources, with instructions, McConnell Amendment No. 4867, fell.<P/>McConnell Amendment No. 4869 (to Amendment No. 4868), of a perfecting nature, fell when McConnell Amendment No. 4868 (to (the instructions) Amendment No. 4867), fell.
